Vocabularies.Definition: n.   quickness of movement; hurry 急忙；匆忙
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She made haste to tell her mother the good news.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   be typical of (sb./sth.); be characteristic of 成为…的特征；以…为特征
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Bright colors and bold strokes characterize his early paintings.

Vocabularies.Definition: in motion; in flight 正在进行中；在飞行中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He likes to photograph birds on the wing.

Vocabularies.Definition: influenced by urgency or compulsion; suffering stress 被催逼的；承受压力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is constantly under pressure and it is affecting her health.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （书）卷，册；体积；分量
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Volume 2 of Shaw's Complete Works is missing.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. be a sign of (sth.); mean 表示…的意思；意味
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He signified his content with a nod.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. （使）非常兴奋，（使）非常激动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We thrilled at the good news.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   read or glance through information carried on computer networks; examine books in a casual way （网上）浏览；翻阅书刊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He often browses through newspapers during lunch.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 给…加标题（或说明文字等）；为…配字幕
a. that cannot be penetrated by water 不透水的；防水的
ad.   向前方，向前
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The explorers ventured forth to discover new land.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. having the same distance between each other at every point  平行的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The railway line runs parallel with the highway.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.    decide to do sth.; choose 选择；作出抉择
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They opt for more holiday instead of more pay.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. noisy activity; agitation 喧嚣繁忙；激动不安
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  the buzz of voices in the crowded room

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   state or power of enduring 忍耐力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The marathon tests a runner's endurance.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   acknowledge, often reluctantly; say or admit (that one has committed a crime, etc.) 承认；坦白，供认
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Mr. Foster confessed that he'd broken the speed limit.

Vocabularies.Definition: it is not surprising that 难怪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Under such circumstances, it is no wonder that he experiences difficulties.

Vocabularies.Word: run the risk of/ a risk
Vocabularies.Definition: do sth. that exposes one to a danger, possibility, etc. 冒（…）危险
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If we don't take more money with us, we run the risk of running out over the weekend.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. prevent sth. from being in effect for a time; hang (sth.) up 暂停，中止；悬，挂
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We suspended the building work during the rain.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. area or region with a particular feature 区域；范围；地带
